    LMU Munich Course

    lmu_course.Rmd

    General information

    This course is partly an online course, partly a 5-day course at LMU.

    The target audience is statistics and data science students. We also welcome students from computer science or any other institute or faculty, as long as we have enough space.

    Flipped classroom block course

    The active part - solving exercises, discussing material - will happen during the in-person classes, while the passive part - watching course videos, reading material - will happen on your own time and at a place of your choice.

    It is extremely important that you watch the videos and try to understand the course material before we meet for class! The exercises, code demos and activities that we will work on together during the in-person classes all depend on the knowledge you gain by working on the course materials in advance. This is not a passive, lecture-type course – you need to be active yourself and prepare each day in a self-directed fashion like the responsible adult that you are.

    Moodle

    All course specific information is available on Moodle. You HAVE to enroll in moodle and you will HAVE to register for the exam there. If the course is booked out, you can still follow the online material, but you cannot participate in this course. This also means: if you booked the course but do not intend to participate in the course, please leave the course on Moodle so others can join!

    We will use Moodle to communicate with you.

    Online material

    To participate in the course you have to work through the online material before the first in-person class. Please do not underestimate how much time this will take.

    Please go through all learning compendia listed in Content.

    In-Person class

    The in-person classes will be on the following days:

    • Tue 24.03.
    • Wed 25.03.
    • Fri 27.03.
    • Mon 30.03.
    • Tue 31.03.

    We will try to more or less stick to the following schedule:

    • 09:30 - 11:00 Discussion of exercises from day before + Questions about course content
    • 11:00 - 12:00 Code demos in R
    • 12:00 - 13:00 Lunch break
    • 13:00 - 15:00 Solving exercises in groups/alone (supervised)
    • 15:00 - 17:00 Unsupervised self study / Work on practical exercises in groups

    Please bring your laptop for the practical work!

    Exercises:

    We will go through some exercises in the In-Person classes, which you do not have to prepare in advance.

    Exercises coming soon!

    Developed by Bernd Bischl, Fabian Scheipl, Heidi Seibold, Christoph Molnar, Ludwig Bothmann, Daniel Schalk.
